page.title: 13ART AND CRAFT IN DUFTON
page.content: There are several artists amongst the inhabitants of Dufton.3 or 4 go to a weekly art class in a neighbouring village.Pictures are mainly local views done in watercolours and occasionally in oils. At least 3 people devote a great deal of time to sewing:1 to American patch- work and quilting,1 to various forms of embroidery (which she also teaches at evening classes), 1 to a variety of crafts with needle, knitting & modelling.Work from all these are exhibited in the local annual show. Materials are mostly bought locally, but for patchwork Laura Ashley cottons are bought direct from the factory. Ideas and patterns are found in magazines and pattern books, or are own-designed or may be a traditional craft like corn dollies or crochet.
